name: Abbey Manor Luxury Guesthouse

reviews.text: When we arrived at Abbey Manor we were tired and hot - we were welcomed in a very warm way and immediately offered drinks and a seat.
reviews.title: Excellent Rooms, Excellent Service - Home from Home

likes.disliked: — Steep steps to front of property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying one night in a smaller room (#6 I think) and three nights in a larger room (#1 I think). We were given a tour.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even the smaller room was spacious and quite charming, but when we moved to the other room, it was just stunning, with excellent views and a large balcony.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to creep out at 04:30 to get a flight to Joburg and when we returned, later in the day, everything had been moved into our new room for us.
reviews.title: amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was large, comfortable and the decor was classic colonial style, homely without being fussy.
reviews.title: A must stay in Cape Town

likes.disliked: — there was nothing we didn't like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would probably go for 4 and a half out of 5 but I can't. The extra touches just scraped it up there to 5 for a B&B. Would be a 4 vs a hotel.
reviews.title: Really great service, 4 and half out of 5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Liked
reviews.title: Certainly our first choice for the next visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommendations on what to do/ personal touch
reviews.title: The place to stay in Cape Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Laptop with free internet
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast
reviews.title: So pleased we chose Abbey Manor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from our honeymoon in South Africa and we cannot say enough kind words about the Abbey Manor. Judi and her staff run an incredibly tight ship. The house itself manages to be both luxurious and cozy. Our room (#3) had a fantastic view, an amazing giant bed, and a clawfoot tub that looked out our giant picture window. Breakfasts were delicious. And Judi and the staff made sure our every need was handled. We stayed for four nights, but could have stayed much longer. If you want a five star experience with a personal touch, this is the place!
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay!

reviews.text: A friend and I decided to stay at this guest house hoping for some individual attention and local information rather than being just a room number. We weren't disapointed. A transfer was arranged at Cape Town airport which worked fine. We only had a short time in Cape Town and Judy the owner sat down with us when we arrived and told us all the best ways of seeing all we wanted. She had a local contact she recommended who chauffered us to all the local sights.
reviews.title: Brilliant position, dont stay anywhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and comfortable away from all the hustle and bustle of Cape Town centre, it had beautiful views of Table Mountain. The pool was a bonus as it was very hot at the time we were there. The breakfast was lovely and set you up for the day. We were even allowed to order take away pizza and eat it in our room as we were too tired to go out looking for restaurants!
reviews.title: Loved the sumptuous comfort

likes.liked: — Sumptuous accomodation and excellent, friendly service
likes.disliked: — Lots of steps and prone to high winds off Table Mountain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beaufifully appointed guest house in a very convenient location less than 10 mins from the cable car or from the V&A waterfront. Very easy to find from the airport. the Devil's Peak room had superb views over towards the mountains, was very elegantly appointed and had the most comfortable bed of all the places we stayed in in our 3 week visit from the UK!
reviews.title: Nothing but amazing!
Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: The breakfasts were very high quality and set the scene for a holiday which added 7lbs to the waistline! Service was excellent. Judi and the staff were a mine of information and nothing was too much trouble. Thanks for sorting out the trip to Langa and Robben Island for us. It made things so much easier.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated in a quiet neighbourhood, Abbey Manor occupies an enviable location. From the front of this most elegant of houses, which retains several of its original arts and crafts features, there are views over Cape Town.Spectacular views of Table Mountain may be enjoyed from the roof terrace at the rear of the property.
reviews.title: Applause -worthy Abbey

likes.disliked: — carrying luggage to the front door

reviews.title: Wonderful days at Abbey Manor
reviews.text: It`s possible to walk downhill into town, but you might find that you will have insufficient energy left in order to enjoy the attractions of downtown Cape Town along with the attractive waterfront. A taxi to the V&A Waterfront should not cost more that 60 rand. A strong feature of the Abbey is that you are very well placed to escape from Cape Town in order to explore the spectacular Cape Peninsular without having to drive through any busy traffic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bedroom was furnished to a high degree of comfort and with meticulous attention to detail. The bathroom was luxurious and the comfy beds and pillows ensure a sound night`s sleep. The staff will make you feel "at home" immediately and will do their utmost to ensure that your stay is pleasurable.
reviews.title: Superb in every way

likes.disliked: — There was simply nothing to dislike

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to enjoy an extensive breakfast served on the pool terrace during unseasonably warm weather. To be recommended is Jacki`s omelet: have everything down to the pesto.
reviews.title: Perfect for exploring Cape Town
excellent
reviews.text: Tip....If you don`t fancy going out to eat, an alternative is to get a picnic and a bottle of chilled wine from the excellent deli which is only two minutes walk away. It`s possible to picnic on the roof terrace whilst enjoying the view of Table Mountain.

description: Abbey Manor is a luxury guesthouse set high on the foothills of Table Mountain, overlooking the splendor of Cape Town. Centrally located, Abbey Manor offers sumptuous rooms - each individually decorated - offering dramatic views of the city, ocean, or majestic mountains, and cater to the highest level of comfort. Offering free WiFi Internet connection, gourmet breakfast, every room air-conditioned and unique, secluded solar heated swimming pool, airport pickup and drop off.
